text: The United States was founded in the year 1776.
The Boston Tea Party was a 1773 protest against British taxes in which colonists disguised as Mohawks dumped a valuable trade good into Boston Harbor.
One of the events that lead to the Revolutionary War was the Boston Massacre where 5 colonists were killed by British soldiers.
President of the Continental Congress, John Hancock was first to sign the Declaration of Independence.
Benjamin Franklin was an American patriot, writer, printer, and inventor. During the Revolutionary War he persuaded the French to help the colonists.
